game

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Animates all of our GameObjects using an array of Images converted to frames.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int animationDirection 
      private int currentFrame 
      private int frameCount 
      private int frameDelay 
      private java.util.List<Frame> frames 
      private boolean stopped 
      private int totalFrames 

    • Constructor Summary

      The constructor for the Animation class that will set all the variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Creates a new Frame object with the given image and duration.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite() 
      void reset()
      Resets the animation.
      void restart()
      Restarts the Animation to the first frame and animates.
      void start()
      Starts the animation.
      void stop()
      Stops the animation.
      void update()
      This is what updates the animation to correctly display the image/frame that we are currently on.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] frames,
                 int frameDelay)
        The constructor for the Animation class that will set all the variables.
        Parameters:
        frames - The array of images to animate.
        frameDelay - The delay between frames.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the animation.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the animation.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Restarts the Animation to the first frame and animates.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the animation. Stopping it and setting it back to the beginning frame.

      • addFrame

        private void addFrame(java.awt.image.BufferedImage frame,
                      int duration)
        Creates a new Frame object with the given image and duration.
        Parameters:
        frame - Frame to be added.
        duration - duration of the frame.

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite()
        Returns:
        Returns the image that the animation is currently on.

      • update

        public void update()
        This is what updates the animation to correctly display the image/frame that we are currently on.
